channel.title: Black and White Photography on Tim Nault Photography
channel.description: Recent content in Black and White Photography on Tim Nault Photography

item.title: In Time
item.description:
In Time CAPTURING THE ELEMENT OF TIME Creator – The Episcopal Church of the Creator in Mechanicsville, VA.
Convergence – Between two realities lies the convergence of time and space
Cypress of Solace – The cypress stands tall against time providing solace in a barren wasteland.
Ethereal Drift – A serene statue, graveside at Hollywood Cemetery in Richmond Virginia.

item.title: Inspire
item.description:
Inspire UPLIFTING POSITIVE MESSAGES Lighting The Way – Sometimes you must reflect in order to light the way forward.
In Love – Hand in hand in love..
InHonor And Memory – The peak of the National Museum of the Marine Corps.
Loving Sentiments – Sweetheart Tree in Maymont Park, Richmond VA.
Wings – Wings at World War 2 memorial Washington DC.

item.title: Yin_and_Yang
item.description:
Yin_and_Yang In the Yin and Yang philosophy, opposite or contrary forces are actually complementary and interdependent. This is true of architecture and its connection with the surrounding cultures and environments. One influences the other in a balanced harmony. This portfolio explores the use of architectural elements in a Yin and Yang design. Architectural Black And White #1 – Architectural Black And White Diptych #1
Architectural Black And White #2 – Architectural Black And White Diptych #2

item.title: Desertification
item.description:
Desertification The processes by which an area becomes a desert Desertification/Desertification #1 – Artistic rendition of a tent made to appear as sand dunes.
Desertification/Desertification #2 – Artistic rendition of a tent made to appear as sand dunes.
Desertification/Desertification #3 – Artistic rendition of a tent made to appear as sand dunes.
Desertification/Desertification #4 – Artistic rendition of a tent made to appear as sand dunes.

item.title: Egyptian Revival
item.description: The first Egyptian dynasty is believed to have began around 3000 B.C. For over two millennia Egypt reined as the richest and most civilized of cultures. The art and architecture of the lasting ruins of tombs and temples present a glimpse into this ancient world. Five thousand years later these motifs and imagery of ancient Egypt are reborn in of all places Richmond,Virginia. This folio explores the revival architecture of the Medical College of Virginiaâ€™s Egyptian Building.

item.title: Once Was
item.description:
Once Was A LOOK AT PLACES ONCE ALIVE AND THRIVING Window To ThePast – Window of the cannon foundry at The American Civil War Center on the grounds of Tredegar Iron Works in Richmond Virginia.
Jackson Ward Sisrene Grocery – Advertising for the Sisrene Grocery in the Jackson Ward of Richmond Virginia.
Weathered Plant – Weathered processing plant in Richmond VA.

item.title: Oncwe Was
item.description:
Urban Scenes A GLIMPSE INTO BUSY CITY LIFE South Water – Bus and pedestrians on South Water street Chicago Illinois.
Dilemma – Man standing in alley way Chicago Illinois.
Avoiding The Signs – Sometimes we avoid the signs even though their meanings are clear as day.
SoF ast – The city moves…
Rush To Nowhere – In life sometimes we rush towards things only to find out they lead to nowhere we want to be.

item.title: The Art Institute
item.description:
The Art Institute The Art Institute of Chicago is a classical Beaux-Arts architecture incorporating a blend of French neoclassicism, Gothic, and Renaissance elements. The Art Institute of Chicago #1 – The Art Institute of Chicago.
The Art Institute of Chicago #2 – The Art Institute of Chicago.
The Art Institute of Chicago #3 – The Art Institute of Chicago.
The Art Institute of Chicago #4 – The Art Institute of Chicago.
